IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: EMPOWERMENT THROUGH OPPORTUNITY; WE BELIEVE THAT THE PURSUIT OF HIGHER EDUCATION IS THE MOST IMPORTANT PASSAGE OF OUR YOUTH MEMBERSHIP.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO PROVIDE A YOUTH DEVELOPMENT AGENCY DEDICATED TO OFFERING CHILDREN AND TEENS PROGRAMS DESIGNED TO DEVELOP INDIVIDUAL, SOCIAL AND COMMUNITY CONSCIOUSNESS; TO PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES FOR YOUTH TO EMPOWER THEMSELVES WHILE BETTERING THEIR COMMUNITIES; TO EDUCATE THE GENERAL PUBLIC ABOUT THE NEEDS OF CHILDREN AND TEENS, AND ENCOURAGE ACTIVE INVOLVEMENT WITH YOUTHS BY ADULTS FROM THEIR COMMUNITY WHO CAN BE THEIR MENTORS AND FRIENDS; TO HELP PROVIDE MORAL VALUES, THE IMPORTANCE OF WORKING TOGETHER WITH OTHERS, THE IMPORTANCE OF HONESTY, AND BEING RESPONSIBLE AND ACCOUNTABLE FOR THEIR ACTIONS, AND TO HELP THEM LEARN HOW TO RESIST PEER PRESSURES TO ENGAGE IN UNDESIRABLE OR RISKY BEHAVIOR OR ILLEGAL ACTIVITIES.
IRS990.Desc: THE ORGANIZATION SUPPORTS A CHARTER SCHOOL SERVING HIGH RISK YOUTH AND MENTORINGPROGRAM SERVING OVER 100 HIGH RISK YOUTH. THE SCHOOL PROVIDES EXTENDED DAY ANDEXTENDED YEAR PROGRAMMING. THE MENTORING PROGRAM PROVIDES COUNSELING, ACADEMICTUTORING, SPORTS PARTICIPATION AND TRANSPORTATION. THE CHARTER SCHOOL IS OPERATEDUNDER CONTRACT WITH THE MEDFORD SCHOOL DISTRICT. THE MENTORING PROGRAM IS OPERATEDWITH THE ASSISTANCE OF JACKSON COUNTY, MEDFORD SCHOOL DISTRICT, AND EAGLE POINTSCHOOL DISTRICT.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: THE ORGANIZATION SUPPORTS A CHARTER SCHOOL SERVING HIGH RISK YOUTH AND MENTORINGPROGRAM SERVING OVER 100 HIGH RISK YOUTH. THE SCHOOL PROVIDES EXTENDED DAY ANDEXTENDED YEAR PROGRAMMING. THE MENTORING PROGRAM PROVIDES COUNSELING, ACADEMICTUTORING, SPORTS PARTICIPATION AND TRANSPORTATION. THE CHARTER SCHOOL IS OPERATEDUNDER CONTRACT WITH THE MEDFORD SCHOOL DISTRICT. THE MENTORING PROGRAM IS OPERATEDWITH THE ASSISTANCE OF JACKSON COUNTY, MEDFORD SCHOOL DISTRICT, AND EAGLE POINTSCHOOL DISTRICT.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: DAILY, STRUCTURED AFTER-SCHOOL PROGRAMS BETWEEN 2:30 AND 6:00 PM. INCLUDES HOMEWORKTUTORING, ART APPRECIATION AND CLASSES. APPROXIMATELY 1,000 CHILDREN THROUGH MIDDLESCHOOL YEARS PARTICIPATE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part III, Line 4d: Other Program Services Description
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 4: NINE-WEEK SUMMER CAMP PROGRAM SERVING OVER 500 CHILDREN AGES 6-15. THE CAMP IS STRUCTURED INTO A 10-HOUR DAY AND PROVIDES LUNCH AND SNACKS AS WELL AS CULTURAL ENHANCEMENT, EDUCATION, FIELD TRIPS/OUTINGS, INDOOR AND OUT DOOR RECREATION. OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 5: THE ORGANIZATION SUPPORTS A CHARTER SCHOOL SERVING HIGH RISK YOUTH AND MENTORINGPROGRAM SERVING OVER 100 HIGH RISK YOUTH. THE SCHOOL PROVIDES EXTENDED DAY ANDEXTENDED YEAR PROGRAMMING. THE MENTORING PROGRAM PROVIDES COUNSELING, ACADEMICTUTORING, SPORTS PARTICIPATION AND TRANSPORTATION. THE CHARTER SCHOOL IS OPERATEDUNDER CONTRACT WITH THE MEDFORD SCHOOL DISTRICT. THE MENTORING PROGRAM IS OPERATEDWITH THE ASSISTANCE OF JACKSON COUNTY, MEDFORD SCHOOL DISTRICT, AND EAGLE POINTSCHOOL DISTRICT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b: Form 990 Review Process
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE 990 IS REVIEWED BY A OUTSIDE CPA, BOOKKEEPER, ADMINISTRATIVE STAFF, AND THEN THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. AFTER THE REVIEW PROCESS, THE 990 IS THEN APPROVED BY THE BOARD FOR FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: NEW VENDORS ARE REVIEWED UPON CONTRACT AWARD TO DETERMINE ANY CONFLICTS OF INTEREST WITH CURRENT EMPLOYEES, DIRECTORS, OFFICERS, OR KEY EMPLOYEES. EMPLOYEES AND THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS ARE REQUIRED TO SIGN A WRITTEN CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY UPON HIRE OR ADMISSION TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, AND ANNUALLY THEREAFTER, DISCLOSING ANY CONFLICTS OF INTEREST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15a: Compensation Review & Approval Process - CEO, Top Management
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND EXECUTIVE STAFF DETERMINE COMPENSATION BASED ON INDUSTRY STANDARDS, FUNDING ALLOCATIONS, AND OTHER ORGANIZATION CONDITIONS. EXECUTIVE STAFF ARE RECUSED DURING THE DETERMINATION OF THE EXECUTIVE STAFF'S COMPENSATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST IN PERSON, IN WRITING, OR VIA TELEPHONE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part XII, Line 2: Change of Oversight or Selection Process
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S PROCESS FOR SELECTION AND OVERSIGHT OF THE INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT DID NOT CHANGE DURING THE YEAR.
